summary.long: Hosea is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Hosea the son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Lord began to speak by Hosea, the Lord said to Hosea:
“Go, take yourself a wife of harlotry
And children of harlotry,
For the land has committed great harlotry
By departing from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he went and took Gomer the daughter of Diblaim, and she conceived and bore him a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord said to him:
“Call his name Jezreel,
For in a little while
I will avenge the bloodshed of Jezreel on the house of Jehu,
And bring an end to the kingdom of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall come to pass in that day
That I will break the bow of Israel in the Valley of Jezreel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And she conceived again and bore a daughter. Then God said to him:
“Call her name Lo-Ruhamah,
For I will no longer have mercy on the house of Israel,
But I will utterly take them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I will have mercy on the house of Judah,
Will save them by the Lord their God,
And will not save them by bow,
Nor by sword or battle,
By horses or horsemen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when she had weaned Lo-Ruhamah, she conceived and bore a son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then God said:
“Call his name Lo-Ammi,
For you are not My people,
And I will not be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet the number of the children of Israel
Shall be as the sand of the sea,
Which cannot be measured or numbered.
And it shall come to pass
In the place where it was said to them,
‘You are not My people,’
There it shall be said to them,
‘You are sons of the living God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the children of Judah and the children of Israel
Shall be gathered together,
And appoint for themselves one head;
And they shall come up out of the land,
For great will be the day of Jezreel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to your brethren, ‘My people,’
And to your sisters, ‘Mercy is shown.’
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lest I strip her naked
And expose her, as in the day she was born,
And make her like a wilderness,
And set her like a dry land,
And slay her with thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not have mercy on her children,
For they are the children of harlotry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their mother has played the harlot;
She who conceived them has behaved shamefully.
For she said, ‘I will go after my lovers,
Who give me my bread and my water,
My wool and my linen,
My oil and my drink.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, behold,
I will hedge up your way with thorns,
And wall her in,
So that she cannot find her paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will chase her lovers,
But not overtake them;
Yes, she will seek them, but not find them.
Then she will say,
‘I will go and return to my first husband,
For then it was better for me than now.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she did not know
That I gave her grain, new wine, and oil,
And multiplied her silver and gold—
Which they prepared for Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore I will return and take away
My grain in its time
And My new wine in its season,
And will take back My wool and My linen,
Given to cover her nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now I will uncover her lewdness in the sight of her lovers,
And no one shall deliver her from My hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also cause all her mirth to cease,
Her feast days,
Her New Moons,
Her Sabbaths—
All her appointed feasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And I will destroy her vines and her fig trees,
Of which she has said,
‘These are my wages that my lovers have given me.’
So I will make them a forest,
And the beasts of the field shall eat them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will punish her
For the days of the Baals to which she burned incense.
She decked herself with her earrings and jewelry,
And went after her lovers;
But Me she forgot,” says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Therefore, behold, I will allure her,
Will bring her into the wilderness,
And speak comfort to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will give her her vineyards from there,
And the Valley of Achor as a door of hope;
She shall sing there,
As in the days of her youth,
As in the day when she came up from the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And it shall be, in that day,”
Says the Lord,
“That you will call Me ‘My Husband,’
And no longer call Me ‘My Master,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will take from her mouth the names of the Baals,
And they shall be remembered by their name no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In that day I will make a covenant for them
With the beasts of the field,
With the birds of the air,
And with the creeping things of the ground.
Bow and sword of battle I will shatter from the earth,
To make them lie down safely.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness,
And you shall know the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It shall come to pass in that day
That I will answer,” says the Lord;
“I will answer the heavens,
And they shall answer the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth shall answer
With grain,
With new wine,
And with oil;
They shall answer Jezreel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will sow her for Myself in the earth,
And I will have mercy on her who had not obtained mercy;
Then I will say to those who were not My people,
‘You are My people!’
And they shall say, ‘You are my God!’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to me, “Go again, love a woman who is loved by a lover and is committing adultery, just like the love of the Lord for the children of Israel, who look to other gods and love the raisin cakes of the pagans.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver, and one and one-half homers of barley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said to her, “You shall stay with me many days; you shall not play the harlot, nor shall you have a man—so, too, will I be toward you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the children of Israel shall abide many days without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred pillar, without ephod or teraphim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward the children of Israel shall return and seek the Lord their God and David their king. They shall fear the Lord and His goodness in the latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear the word of the Lord,
You children of Israel,
For the Lord brings a charge against the inhabitants of the land: 
“There is no truth or mercy
Or knowledge of God in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By swearing and lying,
Killing and stealing and committing adultery,
They break all restraint,
With bloodshed upon bloodshed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Now let no man contend, or rebuke another;
For your people are like those who contend with the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge.
Because you have rejected knowledge,
I also will reject you from being priest for Me;
Because you have forgotten the law of your God,
I also will forget your children.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They eat up the sin of My people;
They set their heart on their iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it shall be: like people, like priest.
So I will punish them for their ways,
And reward them for their deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “Harlotry, wine, and new wine enslave the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people ask counsel from their wooden idols,
And their staff informs them.
For the spirit of harlotry has caused them to stray,
And they have played the harlot against their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They offer sacrifices on the mountaintops,
And burn incense on the hills,
Under oaks, poplars, and terebinths,
Because their shade is good.
Therefore your daughters commit harlotry,
And your brides commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will not punish your daughters when they commit harlotry,
Nor your brides when they commit adultery;
For the men themselves go apart with harlots,
And offer sacrifices with a ritual harlot.
Therefore people who do not understand will be trampled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Though you, Israel, play the harlot,
Let not Judah offend.
Do not come up to Gilgal,
Nor go up to Beth Aven,
Nor swear an oath, saying, ‘As the Lord lives’—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For Israel is stubborn
Like a stubborn calf;
Now the Lord will let them forage
Like a lamb in open country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ephraim is joined to idols,
Let him alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their drink is rebellion,
They commit harlotry continually.
Her rulers dearly love dishonor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wind has wrapped her up in its wings,
And they shall be ashamed because of their sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Hear this, O priests!
Take heed, O house of Israel!
Give ear, O house of the king!
For yours is the judgment,
Because you have been a snare to Mizpah
And a net spread on Tabor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The revolters are deeply involved in slaughter,
Though I rebuke them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“They do not direct their deeds
Toward turning to their God,
For the spirit of harlotry is in their midst,
And they do not know the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“With their flocks and herds
They shall go to seek the Lord,
But they will not find Him;
He has withdrawn Himself from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have dealt treacherously with the Lord,
For they have begotten pagan children.
Now a New Moon shall devour them and their heritage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Blow the ram’s horn in Gibeah,
The trumpet in Ramah!
Cry aloud at Beth Aven,
‘Look behind you, O Benjamin!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim shall be desolate in the day of rebuke;
Among the tribes of Israel I make known what is sure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The princes of Judah are like those who remove a landmark;
I will pour out My wrath on them like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment,
Because he willingly walked by human precept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I will be to Ephraim like a moth,
And to the house of Judah like rottenness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When Ephraim saw his sickness,
And Judah saw his wound,
Then Ephraim went to Assyria
And sent to King Jareb;
Yet he cannot cure you,
Nor heal you of your wound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will be like a lion to Ephraim,
And like a young lion to the house of Judah.
I, even I, will tear them and go away;
I will take them away, and no one shall rescue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will return again to My place
Till they acknowledge their offense.
Then they will seek My face;
In their affliction they will earnestly seek Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let us know,
Let us pursue the knowledge of the Lord.
His going forth is established as the morning;
He will come to us like the rain,
Like the latter and former rain to the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O Ephraim, what shall I do to you?
O Judah, what shall I do to you?
For your faithfulness is like a morning cloud,
And like the early dew it goes away.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For I desire mercy and not sacrifice,
And the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But like men they transgressed the covenant;
There they dealt treacherously with Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gilead is a city of evildoers
And defiled with blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed for you,
When I return the captives of My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They make a king glad with their wickedness,
And princes with their lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They are all adulterers.
Like an oven heated by a baker—
He ceases stirring the fire after kneading the dough,
Until it is leavened.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are all hot, like an oven,
And have devoured their judges;
All their kings have fallen.
None among them calls upon Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ephraim has mixed himself among the peoples;
Ephraim is a cake unturned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Aliens have devoured his strength,
But he does not know it;
Yes, gray hairs are here and there on him,
Yet he does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the pride of Israel testifies to his face,
But they do not return to the Lord their God,
Nor seek Him for all this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ephraim also is like a silly dove, without sense—
They call to Egypt,
They go to Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to them, for they have fled from Me!
Destruction to them,
Because they have transgressed against Me!
Though I redeemed them,
Yet they have spoken lies against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They did not cry out to Me with their heart
When they wailed upon their beds. 
“They assemble together for grain and new wine,
They rebel against Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I disciplined and strengthened their arms,
Yet they devise evil against Me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They return, but not to the Most High;
They are like a treacherous bow.
Their princes shall fall by the sword
For the cursings of their tongue.
This shall be their derision in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Set the trumpet to your mouth!
He shall come like an eagle against the house of the Lord,
Because they have transgressed My covenant
And rebelled against My law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel will cry to Me,
‘My God, we know You!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Israel has rejected the good;
The enemy will pursue him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They set up kings, but not by Me;
They made princes, but I did not acknowledge them.
From their silver and gold
They made idols for themselves—
That they might be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your calf is rejected, O Samaria!
My anger is aroused against them—
How long until they attain to innocence?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“They sow the wind,
And reap the whirlwind.
The stalk has no bud;
It shall never produce meal.
If it should produce,
Aliens would swallow it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, though they have hired among the nations,
Now I will gather them;
And they shall sorrow a little,
Because of the burden of the king of princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because Ephraim has made many altars for sin,
They have become for him altars for sinning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have written for him the great things of My law,
But they were considered a strange thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the sacrifices of My offerings they sacrifice flesh and eat it,
But the Lord does not accept them.
Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins.
They shall return to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rejoice, O Israel, with joy like other peoples,
For you have played the harlot against your God.
You have made love for hire on every threshing floor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The threshing floor and the winepress
Shall not feed them,
And the new wine shall fail in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall not dwell in the Lord’s land,
But Ephraim shall return to Egypt,
And shall eat unclean things in Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
What will you do in the appointed day,
And in the day of the feast of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The days of punishment have come;
The days of recompense have come.
Israel knows!
The prophet is a fool,
The spiritual man is insane,
Because of the greatness of your iniquity and great enmity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They are deeply corrupted,
As in the days of Gibeah.
He will remember their iniquity;
He will punish their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I found Israel
Like grapes in the wilderness;
I saw your fathers
As the firstfruits on the fig tree in its first season.
But they went to Baal Peor,
And separated themselves to that shame;
They became an abomination like the thing they loved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Ephraim, their glory shall fly away like a bird—
No birth, no pregnancy, and no conception!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they bring up their children,
Yet I will bereave them to the last man.
Yes, woe to them when I depart from them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as I saw Ephraim like Tyre, planted in a pleasant place,
So Ephraim will bring out his children to the murderer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give them, O Lord—
What will You give?
Give them a miscarrying womb
And dry breasts!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“All their wickedness is in Gilgal,
For there I hated them.
Because of the evil of their deeds
I will drive them from My house;
I will love them no more.
All their princes are rebellious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ephraim is stricken,
Their root is dried up;
They shall bear no fruit.
Yes, were they to bear children,
I would kill the darlings of their womb.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For now they say,
“We have no king,
Because we did not fear the Lord.
And as for a king, what would he do for us?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have spoken words,
Swearing falsely in making a covenant.
Thus judgment springs up like hemlock in the furrows of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The inhabitants of Samaria fear
Because of the calf of Beth Aven.
For its people mourn for it,
And its priests shriek for it—
Because its glory has departed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The idol also shall be carried to Assyria
As a present for King Jareb.
Ephraim shall receive shame,
And Israel shall be ashamed of his own counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Samaria, her king is cut off
Like a twig on the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also the high places of Aven, the sin of Israel,
Shall be destroyed.
The thorn and thistle shall grow on their altars;
They shall say to the mountains, “Cover us!”
And to the hills, “Fall on us!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O Israel, you have sinned from the days of Gibeah;
There they stood.
The battle in Gibeah against the children of iniquity
Did not overtake them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When it is My desire, I will chasten them.
Peoples shall be gathered against them
When I bind them for their two transgressions.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You have plowed wickedness;
You have reaped iniquity.
You have eaten the fruit of lies,
Because you trusted in your own way,
In the multitude of your mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore tumult shall arise among your people,
And all your fortresses shall be plundered
As Shalman plundered Beth Arbel in the day of battle—
A mother dashed in pieces upon her children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus it shall be done to you, O Bethel,
Because of your great wickedness.
At dawn the king of Israel
Shall be cut off utterly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When Israel was a child, I loved him,
And out of Egypt I called My son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As they called them,
So they went from them;
They sacrificed to the Baals,
And burned incense to carved images.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I drew them with gentle cords,
With bands of love,
And I was to them as those who take the yoke from their neck.
I stooped and fed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And the sword shall slash in his cities,
Devour his districts,
And consume them,
Because of their own counsels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My people are bent on backsliding from Me.
Though they call to the Most High,
None at all exalt Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How can I give you up, Ephraim?
How can I hand you over, Israel?
How can I make you like Admah?
How can I set you like Zeboiim?
My heart churns within Me;
My sympathy is stirred.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“They shall walk after the Lord.
He will roar like a lion.
When He roars,
Then His sons shall come trembling from the west;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall come trembling like a bird from Egypt,
Like a dove from the land of Assyria.
And I will let them dwell in their houses,”
Says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ephraim has encircled Me with lies,
And the house of Israel with deceit;
But Judah still walks with God,
Even with the Holy One who is faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ephraim feeds on the wind,
And pursues the east wind;
He daily increases lies and desolation.
Also they make a covenant with the Assyrians,
And oil is carried to Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He took his brother by the heel in the womb,
And in his strength he struggled with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, he struggled with the Angel and prevailed;
He wept, and sought favor from Him.
He found Him in Bethel,
And there He spoke to us—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is, the Lord God of hosts.
The Lord is His memorable name.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And Ephraim said,
‘Surely I have become rich,
I have found wealth for myself;
In all my labors
They shall find in me no iniquity that is sin.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But I am the Lord your God,
Ever since the land of Egypt;
I will again make you dwell in tents,
As in the days of the appointed feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though Gilead has idols—
Surely they are vanity—
Though they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal,
Indeed their altars shall be heaps in the furrows of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
By a prophet the Lord brought Israel out of Egypt,
And by a prophet he was preserved.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now they sin more and more,
And have made for themselves molded images,
Idols of their silver, according to their skill;
All of it is the work of craftsmen.
They say of them,
“Let the men who sacrifice kiss the calves!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they shall be like the morning cloud
And like the early dew that passes away,
Like chaff blown off from a threshing floor
And like smoke from a chimney.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Yet I am the Lord your God
Ever since the land of Egypt,
And you shall know no God but Me;
For there is no savior besides Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I knew you in the wilderness,
In the land of great drought.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“So I will be to them like a lion;
Like a leopard by the road I will lurk;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will meet them like a bear deprived of her cubs;
I will tear open their rib cage,
And there I will devour them like a lion.
The wild beast shall tear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“O Israel, you are destroyed,
But your help is from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be your King;
Where is any other,
That he may save you in all your cities?
And your judges to whom you said,
‘Give me a king and princes’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I gave you a king in My anger,
And took him away in My wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The iniquity of Ephraim is bound up;
His sin is stored up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sorrows of a woman in childbirth shall come upon him.
He is an unwise son,
For he should not stay long where children are born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will ransom them from the power of the grave;
I will redeem them from death.
O Death, I will be your plagues!
O Grave, I will be your destruction!
Pity is hidden from My eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he is fruitful among his brethren,
An east wind shall come;
The wind of the Lord shall come up from the wilderness.
Then his spring shall become dry,
And his fountain shall be dried up.
He shall plunder the treasury of every desirable prize.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Samaria is held guilty,
For she has rebelled against her God.
They shall fall by the sword,
Their infants shall be dashed in pieces,
And their women with child ripped open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Israel, return to the Lord your God,
For you have stumbled because of your iniquity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take words with you,
And return to the Lord.
Say to Him,
“Take away all iniquity;
Receive us graciously,
For we will offer the sacrifices of our lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Assyria shall not save us,
We will not ride on horses,
Nor will we say anymore to the work of our hands, ‘You are our gods.’
For in You the fatherless finds mercy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will heal their backsliding,
I will love them freely,
For My anger has turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Those who dwell under his shadow shall return;
They shall be revived like grain,
And grow like a vine.
Their scent shall be like the wine of Lebanon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Ephraim shall say, ‘What have I to do anymore with idols?’
I have heard and observed him.
I am like a green cypress tree;
Your fruit is found in Me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is wise?
Let him understand these things.
Who is prudent?
Let him know them.
For the ways of the Lord are right;
The righteous walk in them,
But transgressors stumble in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator
